column4: when you say crash, do you mean it freezes, or just doesn't seem to do anything? why not try running it from shell, you might see the error then
well it is quite a big drive, if it's already partitioned, then it's ok to cancel, just don't want to cancel it in the middle of a partition, but that step is earlier I think...

GNU/Linux tends to be very fast at formating drives, you might want to use gparted manualy, (e.g system --> admin --> gparted) to partition, and then run it, if that doesn't work you could go even further with either a gparted live cd, which tends to work, or try fdisk, and mkfs.ext3 (or whatever you are formating it as)
